definitions.text: an important question that is in dispute and must be settled
examples: the issue could be settled by requiring public education for everyone
politicians never discuss the real issues

definitions.text: one of a series published periodically
examples: she found an old issue of the magazine in her dentist's waiting room

definitions.text: some situation or event that is thought about
examples: he kept drifting off the topic
he had been thinking about the subject for several years
it is a matter for the police

definitions.text: the act of providing an item for general use or for official purposes (usually in quantity)
examples: a new issue of stamps
the last issue of penicillin was over a month ago

definitions.text: supplies (as food or clothing or ammunition) issued by the government
the income or profit arising from such transactions as the sale of land or other property
examples: the average return was about 5%

definitions.text: a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon
examples: the magnetic effect was greater when the rod was lengthwise
his decision had depressing consequences for business
he acted very wise after the event

definitions.text: the immediate descendants of a person
examples: she was the mother of many offspring
he died without issue
not a day's difference between the emergence of the andrenas and the opening of the willow catkins

definitions.text: an opening that permits escape or release
examples: he blocked the way out
the canyon had only one issue

definitions.text: the act of issuing printed materials
prepare and issue for public distribution or sale
examples: publish a magazine or newspaper

definitions.text: circulate or distribute or equip with
examples: issue a new uniform to the children
supply blankets for the beds

definitions.text: bring out an official document (such as a warrant)

examples: Water issued from the hole in the wall
The words seemed to come out by themselves
write out a check
cut a ticket
Please make the check out to me
